item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, March 4, 2025 at 5:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. The owner of ip4.me/ip6.me, Kevin Loch, passed away (151 points | 39 comments)
2. Bayleaf · Building a low-profile wireless split keyboard (202 points | 60 comments)
3. Satellogic's Open Satellite Feed (55 points | discuss)
4. DiffRhythm: Fast End-to-End Full-Length Song Generation with Latent Diffusion (40 points | 38 comments)
5. Show HN: Appstat – Process Monitor for Windows (31 points | 6 comments)
6. Foundry (YC F24) Hiring Founding Engineer to Build an Internet-Scale Web Crawler ( | hide)
7. Repairable Flatpack Toaster (706 points | 222 comments)
8. Windows NT for GameCube/Wii (170 points | 48 comments)
9. Enhancing Frame Detection with Retrieval Augmented Generation (20 points | 5 comments)
10. Lawrence of Arabia, Paul Atreides, and the roots of Frank Herbert's Dune (2021) (220 points | 121 comments)
11. TSMC expected to announce $100B investment in U.S. (353 points | 714 comments)
12. DeepSeek's smallpond: Bringing Distributed Computing to DuckDB (142 points | 11 comments)
13. The IBM 650: An appreciation from the field (1986) [pdf] (32 points | 12 comments)
14. Show HN: PG-Capture – a better way to sync Postgres with Algolia (or Elastic) (10 points | 1 comment)
15. DIY "infinity contrast" TV – with 100% recycled parts [video] (31 points | 14 comments)
16. SQLite-on-the-server is misunderstood: Better at hyper-scale than micro-scale (297 points | 137 comments)
17. An Experimental Study of Bitmap Compression vs. Inverted List Compression (19 points | 5 comments)
18. Ask HN: Who is hiring? (March 2025) (349 points | 321 comments)
19. Hacking the Xbox 360 Hypervisor Part 2: The Bad Update Exploit (242 points | 88 comments)
20. Ask HN: What less-popular systems programming language are you using? (216 points | 287 comments)
21. The Golden Age of Japanese Pencils (2022) (335 points | 93 comments)
22. Comparing Fuchsia components and Linux containers [video] (201 points | 160 comments)
23. Show HN: Agents.json – OpenAPI Specification for LLMs (175 points | 60 comments)
24. Launch HN: Cuckoo (YC W25) – Real-time AI translator for global teams (72 points | 25 comments)
25. Go-attention: A full attention mechanism and transformer in pure Go (147 points | 66 comments)
26. Microsoft's new Dragon Copilot is an AI assistant for healthcare (77 points | 69 comments)
27. An Attempt to Catch Up with JIT Compilers (175 points | 133 comments)
28. Show HN: FlakeUI (127 points | 49 comments)
29. Ask HN: Who wants to be hired? (March 2025) (162 points | 365 comments)
30. MIT 6.S184: Introduction to Flow Matching and Diffusion Models (362 points | 21 comments)
